page.title: 09SCOTS DYKE
page.content: The earthworks known as the { Scots {Dyke}and which extend from the river {Swale at Richmond}to the river{Tees at {Barforth }are visible near Stanwick. They are believed to be part of the same defensive system as the {Stanwick {Camp eathworks,} their mounds being known as {"Jack-dike Arches".} The nearby{beck}known as {Jack-dike Ditch was renamed the {Mary Wild Beck}after, it is believed, Mary Wild who became the wife of Anthony Catterick owner of the manor and lands of Stanwick in the early 1600's. Archaeology students from{ Durham {University} are just completing the final year of a four year excavation programme of the inner part of the earthworks near the ice house. The work is being done under the supervision of{Mr Percival Turnbull.
